intro: Desmodium gangeticum var. maculatum, commonly known as the spotted hairy sida, is a leguminous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves with distinct purple or red markings on the leaflets. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in racemes. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Its ability to fix nitrogen makes it a valuable plant for soil enrichment and ecological restoration.
